subject: RE: [junit] xUnit results in XML
msgSnippet: David, JUnit, Cactus and HttpUnit can all output XML (see the junitreport Ant task) , which can then be easily transformed using XSLT into whatever format. For
messageBody:
David,

JUnit, Cactus and HttpUnit can all output XML (see the junitreport Ant
task) , which can then be easily transformed using XSLT into whatever
format. For the other ones (non-java), I don't know.

Hope it helps
-Vincent

> -----Original Message-----
> From: dvydra2 [mailto:david@...]
> Sent: 11 April 2002 20:43
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] xUnit results in XML
>
> We are in the process of putting together a company-wide test harness
> architecture. We have a mixture of JUnit, CppUnit, VBUnit,.NET Unit,
> Cactus, HttpUnit, and a variety of homegrown and commercial tools. We
> need to publish the results in one comprehensive format. We are
> looking at extending each tool to output a "standard" XML format that
> will be later digested and published.
> Has anyone gone this way before? Comments please.
> Are there any open-source projects that attempt to address this issue?
>
> Thanks
>
> David Vydra
> Senior Engineer
> www.plumtree.com
>
>
